answers.answer: With your medical problems, I would think you would be having trouble getting out, flatulence or not.  Besides flatulence is a symptom and the least of your problems. Protein should be very limited in your diet. Also fat. Eat complex carbohydrates. The liver has difficulties metabolizing meat and fat. I do not eat bread. I eat Cereal, Non-fat milk, limited meat, a lot of fruit. Try making smoothies, using for instance a package of Orange Smoothie mix, 11oz can of Mandarin Oranges with orange juice about 8 cubes of ice in a blender. Hmmm good.Take Vitamin B-12 (1000mg), Multi Vitamin, Folic Acid. Gerd should be controllable with  "Omeprazole, Peripheral Neuropathy best treatment is Gabapentin.You've had HepC much longer than eight years, maybe just diagnosed eight years ago. I had HepC for 25 yrs before Diagnosed. Cirrhosis for 8 years.Don't blame you for refusing treatment. I did also. Back then it wasn't worth the odds.

question: In the past 8 years I have developed many health problems: Hep-C, Fatty Liver, early signs of cirrhosis, GERD, diabetes II, peripheral neuropathy, severe crippling RA, OA, MGUS, 20 lb. overweight, mild OCD, mild depression.  I also have a serious flatulence problem which is of great embarrasment to me so I stay home a lot.   I have been blaming the flatulence on all the medicine I have been prescribed for all these ailments. I'm tempted to just STOP taking medicine completely. Might that help or would it be too detrimental? I refused to take Interferon treatments because of all the negative side effects. I've recentlty had a liver biopsy, ultrasound, and many lab tests. The only gastroenterologist we have near here is very unpleasant and also unhelpful. I'm a 72 year old woman; I know we are often invisible to physicians. Also, I can't digest meat very well so I have to eat vegetables, fruit, bread.  Those are all carbo foods which tend to cause flatulence, right?  What CAN I eat?Frustrated in IdahoThis discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/235874.
